definition: to provoke/to irritate/to vex/to stir up/to anger/to attract (troubles)/to cause (problems)

sentences.english: Annoyed by vuvuzelas at the World Cup?
sentences.chinese: 世界杯赛场上的呜呜祖拉惹人厌？

sentences.english: Don't be annoying, and especially not on purpose.
sentences.chinese: 别惹人厌，特别是故意这样做。

sentences.english: whether the twitterati are more annoying or just more flighty than everyone else.
sentences.chinese: 也不知道是否社交网络达人会比较惹人厌或更轻浮。

sentences.english: Like Joey's constant knuckle-cracking isn't annoying?
sentences.chinese: 像乔伊，常扳指关节就不惹人厌吗？

sentences.english: Don’t be obnoxious. But do be amazing.
sentences.chinese: 别惹人厌，但要让人惊叹。

sentences.english: It is not an unsympathetic biography, but Sir Edward has taken against it.
sentences.chinese: 这本传记并不惹人厌，可爱德华爵士不喜欢它。

sentences.english: Such rain will never be annoying.
She is obnoxious when she's in a bad mood.
sentences.chinese: 她心情不好的时候很惹人厌。

sentences.english: That's too high,' murmured the provoking thing.
sentences.chinese: “太高啦，”这个惹人厌的东西咕噜着。

definition: (old) girl trafficked into a brothel to work as prostitute
unkind/harsh/cutting/mean/acrimony/to embezzle by making illegal deductions
to be an irksome presence (i.e. sth or sb one wishes were not there)
cannot bear to see/to hate/to dislike/to disapprove
flippant and insincere (piece of writing or speech)/glib-tongued/oily
